00014 /******************************************************************************/
00015 /*                                                                            */
00016 /*            V I R T U A L   M A C H I N E   I N T E R F A C E               */

00018 /*         I N S T R U C T I O N   D E C O D E   U T I L I T I E S            */
00019 /*                                                                            */
00020 /******************************************************************************/
00021 
00022 #ifndef VMI_DECODE_H
00023 #define VMI_DECODE_H
00024 
00025 #include "vmi/simAddrTypes.h"
00026 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00027 
00028 //
00029 // Allocate a new decode table object to decode instructions 'bits' wide ('bits'
00030 // is currently restricted to 8, 16 or 32 only)
00031 //
00032 vmidDecodeTableP vmidNewDecodeTable(Uns32 bits, Uns32 defaultValue);
00033 
00034 //
00035 // Add a new entry to the decode table. 'mask' is a bitmask which is applied to
00036 // a candidate instruction, and 'value' is compared with the masked value. If
00037 // the masked value matches, 'matchValue' is returned.
00038 //
00039 // Sometimes it is required to create conflicting decode entries in a table
00040 // (for example, a particular instruction variant may have a different
00041 // mnemonic or special functionality different to the general case). In such
00042 // cases, use the 'priority' argument to specify which of the conflicting
00043 // decodes should be used (larger 'priority' value are chosen in preference)
00044 //
00045 Bool vmidNewEntry(
00046     vmidDecodeTableP table,
00047     const char      *name,
00048     Uns32            matchValue,
00049     Uns64            mask,
00050     Uns64            value,
00051     Int32            priority
00052 );
00053 
00054 //
00055 // Add a new entry to the decode table using a format string, which describes
00056 // the bit pattern of an opcode from MSB to LSB. The characters in the string
00057 // are as follows:
00058 //
00059 //      '1': corresponding bit must be 1
00060 //      '0': corresponding bit must be 0
00061 //      '|', ',', '/', ' ', tab: ignored
00062 //      any other character: corresponding bit can be either 0 or 1
00063 //
00064 // As an example, this format string specifies a 16-bit opcode with the
00065 // most-significant 5 bits and least-significant 3 bits having fixed values,
00066 // with other bit values unconstrained. Note that the spacer character '|' is
00067 // ignored, and the value '.' is used in this case to denote an unconstrained
00068 // bit value:
00069 //
00070 //      "|10001|........|101|"
00071 //
00072 Bool vmidNewEntryFmtBin(
00073     vmidDecodeTableP table,
00074     const char      *name,
00075     Uns32            matchValue,
00076     const char      *format,
00077     Int32            priority
00078 );
00079 
00080 //
00081 // Decode the passed instruction using the decode table, returning the
00082 // matchValue registered with the matching entry (or defaultValue registered
00083 // with the table if no entry matches)
00084 //
00085 Uns32 vmidDecode(vmidDecodeTableP table, Uns64 instr);
00086 
00087 #endif
00088
